moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Bb4 4. Qc2: Max Euwe reccommendatio  for avoiding the main lines of this opening.
moves.4... O-O 5. a3 Bxc3+ 6. Qxc3 d6 7. Bg5 N: Building a strong center, but black should soon counter with c7-c5 or e6-e5
moves.10... g5 11. Bf2 e4:
The point. Black undermines white his center, making the d5 pawn fulllnerable.
If white takes the pawn he has to exchange his bishop, which I was not prepared to do.
The Bisshop is still needed because black has a major weakness on the line c3-h8.
moves.12. O-O-O: The downside of black tactics is he has exposed his kingside, which white hopes to take advantage of.
moves.12... b5:
Another blow against white center formation.
I was uncomfortable in this position, but decided to counter by taking the fight to his kingside.
moves.13. h4 g4: And another blow. This one is harmless, because black cannot take the f3 pawn without exposing the dangerous g-file. That would allow white to aim Bishop, Queen and Rook against his Royal Highness on g8.
moves.14... bxc4: Proably not best. Black should have increased his thearts again the center with Nb6, or even better Bb7.
moves.15. Bxc4 Nb6 16. Ne2: I would have preferred to save the Bisshop with Bb3, but it costs a pawn after Bb7
moves.16... Bd7: Strange move, that bisshop is needed on b7
moves.17. Bb3:
That bisshop will be needed for my attack on black's king side.
From b3 it is already amaing the balck king, but perhpahs from c2 it might pair up with whites Queen to form a powerfull battery
moves.17... Rc8:
There blacks idea, he want to open the c-file and expose white king.
His main problem is lack of cooperation between his pieces though.
moves.18. Be1: A very strong reply. The move Kb1 would have been the abvious choice, but white has an idea
moves.18... c6 19. Qd4 cxd5+: The right move would have been c6-c5, preventing white plan by forcing the Queen to another field.
moves.20. Bc3:
Even though this bisshop is currenlty pinned, from here it is deadly.
Black isin serious troubles now, but he does not seem to realize the difficulties he has run into.
moves.21. Nf4 Bc4: There is no time for this. Kh7 was the only proper move
moves.22. Nh5: There we go. The night cannot be taken because of Nxh5, Qh8#
moves.23. Ba4 Ne5:
Loses a piece, Be2 would have been better.
23....,Be2; 24.Bxd7, Rxc3+; 25.bxc3; Nxd7; 26.Re2,Bc4; white has won material.
moves.25... Nd7 26. Bxd7:
But not 26.Qxf6, Nx6; 28.Bxf6 because of Be2+ and white only wins the exchange.
At this point black surrendered, because he will stay a piece down.

The best move in this game, I think was 18.Be1 creating the deadly Bishop-Queen battery
